intro: Agouticarpa isernii, commonly known as the Iberian agouti fruit, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes cucumbers and gourds, and is characterized by its climbing habit and tendrils. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that are typically green when mature, with a distinctive, spiky texture. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
